form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Lee introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To prohibit Federal funding for the Public Broadcasting Service and National Public Radio and to provide for the transfer of certain Federal funds that would have been made available to those organizations to reduce the public debt, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Defund Government-Sponsored Propaganda Act.

section.header: Prohibition on Federal funding for Public Broadcasting Service and National Public Radio

subsection.text: After the date of enactment of this Act, no Federal funds may, directly or indirectly, be made available to or used to support an organization described in subsection (b), including through the payment of dues to or the purchase of programming from the organization by a public broadcast station using Federal funds received by the station.
The organizations described in this subsection areâ€”

paragraph.text: the organization known, as of the date of enactment of this Act, as the Public Broadcasting Service;
the organization known, as of the date of enactment of this Act, as National Public Radio; and
any successor organization to an organization described in paragraph (1) or (2).

subsection.header: Transfer of certain funds To reduce the public debt
subsection.text: For fiscal years 2025, 2026, and 2027, the Corporation for Public Broadcasting shall transfer to the account established by section 3113(d) of title 31, United States Code, an amount equal to the sum of the amounts allocated under clauses (ii) and (iii) of section 396(k)(3)(A) of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 396(k)(3)(A)) that would have been made available to an organization described in subsection (b) but for the prohibition in subsection (a).
